situation.title: Quarantine
situation.meta_description: You need to quarantine if you have been in high-risk exposure with a person who has been tested positive for coronavirus.

situation.title: Isolation
situation.meta_description: You spend time in home isolation if you have been confirmed as COVID-19 positive.

situation.title: Symptoms
situation.meta_description: What are the symptoms of COVID-19?

situation.title: Difference between RT-PCR test, Rapid antigen test and antibody test
situation.meta_description: RT-PCR looks for viral RNA, Rapid antigen test for viral protein, antibody test for antibodies again the virus.

situation.title: How to get tested?
situation.meta_description: How to make a reservation for COVID-19 testing.

situation.title: Where will the test results be sent?
situation.meta_description: The results of the RT-PCR test will be sent to the e-mail address you provided or to your telephone as a text message within 48 hours at the latest.

situation.title: How to transport yourself to the testing?
situation.meta_description: Ideally, use your car. Try not to use public transport.

situation.title: Contact with an infected person
situation.meta_description: A risky encounter means that a healthy person met with someone who tested positive for COVID-19.

situation.title: Self-reporting
situation.meta_description: If the result of your test is positive, then the text message will also include the code. You use that to gain access to the self-reporting form.

situation.title: Statistical data
situation.meta_description: Detailed overview of the data and analyses.

situation.title: eRouška / eFaceMask
situation.meta_description: The eRouška (meaning eFaceMask) application was created by the “Smart Quarantine” team as one of the tools to get the COVID-19 illness under control and prevent community spread.

situation.title: Treatment
situation.meta_description: If you have COVID-19, you should stay in isolation, rest in bed, drink enough liquids, and contact your general practitioner.

situation.title: When to seek medical attention
situation.meta_description: Description of symptoms inducing medical attention.

situation.title: Diet
situation.meta_description: Pay attention to a healthy and balanced diet, rich in vitamins and minerals- especially vitamins C, D, E, zinc, and selenium (always follow recommended daily doses).

situation.title: I recovered from COVID-19
situation.meta_description: No one knows exactly how long you are immune for after recovering from COVID-19. Experts have agreed that it is at least 90 days.

situation.title: What does the R value mean?
situation.meta_description: The baseline R number for SARS-CoV-2 in a population without any restrictions is around 3.

situation.title: Purpose of the measures
situation.meta_description: The purpose of the governmental measures is to reduce the reproductive number of COVID-19 to such an extent, that the health care system of the Czech Republic can manage the epidemic.

situation.title: State of Emergency
situation.meta_description: The state of emergency is one of the extraordinary measures of the Constitutional Act on the Security of the Czech Republic.

situation.title: How does tracing work?
situation.meta_description: The goal of tracing is to quickly identify potentially infected people, quarantine them and protect the public.

situation.title: Penalties
situation.meta_description: Penalties for violating extraordinary measures
